main event: On January 11, 1958 in Baxley, Georgia, civilian witnesses observed a silver to red light in the sky, which appeared to go into the ground, rise, drop low, and then move into the ground again over a 15-minute period.
interesting points: The object was possibly a balloon, aircraft, astronomical body, or unknown.
The report notes that the information was too scrambled to make a proper evaluation.
Witnesses reported the object as having deep orange light, rising, standing still, dropping, and moving northward before going into the ground.
There were references to flashing red lights below the object on January 26, 1957.
A photograph or illustration of four aircraft heading north above an unspecified object was included in the report.
sighted object: silver to red light in the sky moving into the ground
